meanings.definition: Insufficient exposure of photographic film or plate to light.
meanings.sent1: The photographer was disappointed with the underexposure of the film, resulting in dark and unclear images.
meanings.sent2: The underexposure of the film made the photos too dark to see any details.
meanings.sent3: The underexposure of the film made the pictures look like they were taken at night, even though it was daytime.
meanings.sent4: The underexposure of the film cast a shadow over the entire photo shoot, leaving everything in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The underexposure of the film was like trying to see in a dimly lit room with sunglasses on.

meanings.definition: The condition of being inadequately exposed to a particular experience or situation.
meanings.sent1: His underexposure to different cultures limited his understanding of the world.
meanings.sent2: The underexposure to new technologies left her feeling lost in the modern world.
meanings.sent3: Her underexposure to spicy food made her think ketchup was too hot to handle.
meanings.sent4: The underexposure to the arts left him feeling like he was missing out on a whole world of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The underexposure to nature made her appreciate the beauty of the outdoors even more.
